about.title: About Expat Legal Vietnam
about.quoteText: "I started this service because I saw too many expats making expensive mistakes that could have been avoided with 60 minutes of clear guidance."
about.whyP1: When expats in Vietnam need legal guidance, they face a frustrating reality: information online is outdated, scattered across Facebook groups, or written in Vietnamese. Law firms charge retainers for simple questions. And Google doesn't know about the latest regulatory changes.
about.whyP2: Expat Legal Vietnam fills that gap. One focused consultation. Plain English. Specific to your situation. You leave with an action plan, not more confusion.

faq.0.q: How much does a consultation cost?
faq.0.a: A 60-minute consultation is $150 USD. You get clear, actionable answers specific to your situation ‚Äî not generic advice you can find on Google.
faq.1.q: What topics can you help with?
faq.1.a: Visa options & renewals, business registration (LLC, representative office), apartment rental contracts, family registration, work permits, and general legal navigation for expats in Vietnam.
faq.2.q: Do I need to speak Vietnamese?
faq.2.a: No. All consultations are conducted in English. I handle the Vietnamese paperwork and liaising with local authorities on your behalf.
faq.3.a: Usually within 2-3 business days. For urgent matters, mention it in the booking notes and I'll do my best to accommodate same-day or next-day slots.
faq.4.q: What if my situation is complicated?
faq.4.a: Complicated situations are exactly why this service exists. Book a call and we'll map out your specific path. If your situation requires formal legal representation, I'll refer you to trusted local partners.
faq.5.a: This is a legal consulting service, not a law firm. I provide expert guidance and help you navigate the system. For formal legal representation in court, I work with a network of trusted local attorneys.
